instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0165: What is 820-0165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state but not turning on
threads.message:
No power even with SMC bypass,

<CAPACITOR>C2952</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C2951</CAPACITOR> were corroded and one pad missing, that got replaced.

EFI chip looked corroded so I replaced it with another one and reprogrammed it with a good dump.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.1v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 1.057v
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> 1.5v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state but not turning on
threads.message:
If you get S0 state, your board turns on.
Other thing is that doesn't work.

Possible corrosion under SMC and CPU.
Heat them with good flux and clean the board in UC machine.

Did you correctly rebuild that <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> trace to PCH?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state but not turning on
threads.message:
Cleaned board and heated the SMC with good flux with no luck.

The missing pad was rebuilt correctly yes.

Now after the cleaning and reflow board is not entering S0 state, I will leave this one for later
